channel.title: Tidyeval on Invalid Input
channel.description: Recent content in Tidyeval on Invalid Input

item.title: That time I thought I invented pluck
item.description: Foreword Just before publishing this article, I read the purrr cheatsheet and realised that what I developed here already exists. Its name is pluck and I definetely suggest that you use it. TL;DR This is an attempt to write a R helper function to subset lists that would be as nice as get-in in the functional programming language Clojure. As said above, this is in fact already available in purrr.
